alert.note: Alert for Cortland (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 02 at 4:49AM EDT until May 02 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in New York...Pennsylvania... Susquehanna River At Waverly/Sayre affecting Tioga and Bradford Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New York...Pennsylvania... Susquehanna River At Vestal affecting Tioga and Broome Counties. Susquehanna River At Conklin affecting Susquehanna and Broome Counties. Tioughnioga River At Cortland affecting Cortland County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tioughnioga River At Cortland. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Minor flood stage. Flooding leads to some closures along Kellogg Road to the south of Cortland. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:15 AM EDT Tuesday the stage was 8.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:15 AM EDT Tuesday was 8.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this morning and continue falling to 6.1 feet early Friday morning. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (2 am EDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri Tioughnioga River Cortland 8.0 8.2 Tue 4 am EDT 7.3 6.7 6.1 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
